questions.question: What is the purpose of ORDER BY in SQL?
Which keyword is used to sort results in ascending order?
Which keyword is used to sort results in descending order?
What is the default sort order if ASC or DESC is not specified?
Which clause comes after SELECT and WHERE but before LIMIT?
Can ORDER BY be used on multiple columns?
Which symbol is used to separate multiple columns in ORDER BY?
How does ORDER BY name DESC sort the results?
Which SQL clause is used to sort rows?
Is it valid to use ORDER BY without a WHERE clause?
Write a query to display employees sorted by salary in ascending order.
options: SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY salary ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees SORT BY salary ASC;
ORDER BY salary ASC FROM employees;
questions.answer: SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY salary ASC;

questions.question: Fetch student names ordered by marks from highest to lowest.
options: SELECT name FROM students ORDER BY marks DESC;
SELECT name ORDER BY marks DESC FROM students;
SELECT name FROM students SORT DESC;
SELECT * FROM students WHERE ORDER BY marks DESC;
questions.answer: SELECT name FROM students ORDER BY marks DESC;
